tello.py¶

class tello.Tello¶

Handles the communication between the client and the tello.

fetch()¶

Retrieves the reversed pathing commands and sends the to tello.

initialize()¶

Sends “command” command and if the response was successful, sends “battery” command.

Returns

True if “command” was sent successfully, False if “command” failed

Return type

bool

replay_session(session_file)¶

Reads the command of the session file given and executes them.

Parameters

session_file (string) – The file of the session to be loaded

send_command(command, reverse=False)¶

Sends the given command to tello and waits in a loop for the response.

The loop is exited if the waiting flag is set to False or the timeout window has expired.

Parameters

  • command (string) – The command to be sent

  • reverse (bool) – If the command belongs to reverse pathing commands

Returns

True if the command sent successfully and the response was “OK”. False if the command could not be sent or the response was “ERROR”.

Return type

bool

write_session(session_name)¶

Writes the current session to a txt file by calling log.to_text

Parameters

session_name (string) – The name of the session

Tello
